info.name: 3PL Systems, Inc. - Public API Collection
info.description: Welcome to the 3PL Systems, Inc. API Postman collection. In this collection, you will find our publicly available API suite that includes shipment, customer, carrier, and accounting management. This Postman collection does not provide access to all available APIs. 3PL Systems, Inc. will provide access to other APIs not included in this documentation upon request. In order to gain access to the API, you will first need to gain access to the API keys. These keys are either provided by 3PL Systems, Inc. or the freight brokerage that you're integrating with directly. In the event you have any questions, feel free to email our support team at [Support@3plsystems.com](https://mailto:Support@3plsystems.com) Configuration There are variables already set within the project that you will need to fill out in order to interact with the API endpoints. There are two types of credentials, shipper and system. The shipper credentials are for those looking to interact with the 'Shipper Access Endpoints' and the system credentials are for those looking to interact with the 'Global System' and 'Brokerware Accounting' endpoints. **Available Variables** - baseUrl - The baseURL is the URL that points to the system that you're trying to integrate with. This URL can be provided to you by the company you're trying to push or pull information from. - Client Credentials - The below credentials are generated directly from the Customer Profile on the staff side of the application under 'Customer Tools'. These credentials can be accessed and generated from 'API Keys'. - ClientIdClient - ClientSecretClient - Global Credentials - The below credentials are generated directly from the 'General Information' page accessed in the upper right hand corner of the system by an Admin. You will find the API key button in the bottom left hand area of the 'General Information' page. - Credentials: - ClientIdGlobal - ClientSecretGlobal ### CreateShipmentApiModel - **PickupDate** (DateTime) - **PickupOpenTime** (DateTime) - **PickupCloseTime** (DateTime) - **EstimatedDelivery** (DateTime) - **EstimatedDeliveryOpenTime** (DateTime) - **EstimatedDeliveryCloseTime** (DateTimel) - **DeliveryDate** (DateTime) - **ShipperPickupArrival** (DateTime) - **ShipperPickupDeparture** (DateTime) - **ConsigneeDeliverArrival** (DateTime) - **ConsigneeDeliverDeparture** (DateTime) - **Source** (String; Max: 100 characters) - **PickupNumber** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **PoReference** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperNumber** (String; Max: 100 characters) - **ShipperAddress** (String) - **ShipperAddress2** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperCity** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperName** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperContact** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperEmail** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperPhone** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperFax** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperLocationCode** (String) - **ConsigneeAddress** (String) - **ConsigneeAddress2** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeState** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeCity** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeName** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeContact** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeEmail** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneePhone** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeFax** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeLocationCode** (String) - **IsConsigneeCitySpecified** (Boolean) - **IsShipperCitySpecified** (Boolean) - **ReferenceNumber** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **BillOfLandingNote** (String; Max: 2000 characters) - **PalletCount** (Int32) - **ShipmentValue** (Decimal) - **Carrier** (CreateShipmnetCarrier; Custom class) - **ShipmentStatus** (String) - **CustomFields** (List; Custom class list) - **BillToCode** (Int32?; Optional) - **BuyerClientLoadId** (Int32?; Optional) - **AssignTo** (String) - **Test** (Boolean) - **IsUpdateIfDuplicatedReferenceNumber** (Boolean) - **IsPalletized** (Boolean) - **NumberOfPallets** (Int32) ### CustomField - **FieldName** (String) - **FieldValue** (String) ### CreateShipmnetCarrier - **CarrierScac** (String; Max: 10 characters) - **ProviderScac** (String; Max: 10 characters) - **ProNumber** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **RateQuoteId** (String)

request.description:
Endpoint Overview:

The authentication endpoint is what will provide you with a token to access the APIs provided by 3PL Systems.

Body: client_id, client_secret

The values above can be requested by reaching out to the Broker you are working on integrating into.

request.description:
This documentation details the `Rating` and `RatingByCustomerId` API endpoints, which are used to calculate shipment ratings based on provided shipment details. These APIs are designed for RESTful services and the documentation is tailored for testing and integration using Postman.

#### Rating Endpoint

- **URL**: `/Rating`
    
- **Method**: `POST`
    
- **Authentication**: Required (Bearer Token)
    

##### Request Body

- `customerId` (`int`): The customer ID for which the rating is being calculated.
    
- `RatingApiModel` (`object`): A JSON object containing the details of the shipment for which the rating is being requested. Key fields may include:
    
    - `EquipmentType` (`string`): The type of equipment used for the shipment.
        
    - `ShipmentMode` (`string`): The mode of the shipment.
        
    - `Miles` (`decimal`): The mileage for the shipment.
        
    - `Items` (``List): A list of items being shipped, including details such as weight, class, etc.- `Accessorials` (`List`, optional): A list of accessorials associated with the shipment.      - Additional fields related to shipper and consignee details, such as `ShipperZip`, `ShipperCountry`, `ConsigneeZip`, and `ConsigneeCountry`.       Required Params:   Shipper Zip, Consignee Zip, Class, Weight, Pieces, Packaging, IsHazardous, ShipmentMode, EquipmentType  Note: Excessive length is automatically calculated based on dimensions being passed. It is not required to pass an accessorial to pull back the proper rates.  Mode Types: Intermodal, LTL, Truckload, Air, Drayage, HotShot, LclOcean, VolumePartial, Ocean, InternationalAir, Parcel , Auto , Bulk , RFLtl , Services , Rail , LiquidBulk  StartFragment  Packaging Types: None, Pallets, Boxes, Bundles, Cartons, Cases, Crates, Drums, Pails, Rolls, Stacks, Totes, Wheels, FTL, LTL, Pieces, Bags, Cylinders, Buckets, Skids, Packages, Units, Bins, Coils, Gallons, Containers, LooseBags, Poles, Reels, Sheets, Truckloads, Gaylords, Loose, MixedPallets, Supersacks, Railcar, Tiles, Cans. Note: If Item Packaging does not match to Packaging Type list it will default to Pallets.  EndFragment  EndFragment  You can find the available accessorials by pulling them from here:  [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/1985869/TWDWJch4#06a82358-778d-4723-88a4-11b50e6c3c20](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/1985869/TWDWJch4#06a82358-778d-4723-88a4-11b50e6c3c20)  ``

item.name: Get Carrier Rates by Customer W/ Rate Breakdown

request.description:
The Rate Breakdown Rating API allows you to pull back detailed rates in live time from the Brokerware environment by passing your shipping details to the system.

Required Params:  
Shipper Zip, Consignee Zip, Class, Weight, Pieces, Packaging, IsHazardous, ShipmentMode, EquipmentType

Note: Excessive length is automatically calculated based on dimensions being passed. It is not required to pass an accessorial to pull back the proper rates.

Mode Types: Intermodal, LTL, Truckload, Air, Drayage, HotShot, LclOcean, VolumePartial, Ocean, InternationalAir, Parcel , Auto , Bulk , RFLtl , Services , Rail , LiquidBulk

Packaging Types: None, Pallets, Boxes, Bundles, Cartons, Cases, Crates, Drums, Pails, Rolls, Stacks, Totes, Wheels, FTL, LTL, Pieces, Bags, Cylinders, Buckets, Skids, Packages, Units, Bins, Coils, Gallons, Containers, LooseBags, Poles, Reels, Sheets, Truckloads, Gaylords, Loose, MixedPallets, Supersacks, Railcar, Tiles, Cans. Note: If Item Packaging does not match to Packaging Type list it will default to Pallets.

You can find the available accessorials by pulling them from here:

[https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/1985869/TWDWJch4#06a82358-778d-4723-88a4-11b50e6c3c20](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/1985869/TWDWJch4#06a82358-778d-4723-88a4-11b50e6c3c20)

request.description:
Upload a document to a specific LoadId.

Required: FileName, Extension, DocumentBase64, LoadId, Type  
Extensions: .tiff, .tif, .png, .doc, .xls, .pdf, .txt, .xlsx, .csv, .docx, .jpeg, .jpg, .gif, .pst, .ost, .jfif

Types: BOL, CarrierBill, CarrierPacket, Claim, CreditApp, DeliveryOrder, Detention, Dispatch, DocumentPacket, FactoringDocs, InsuranceDoc, Invoice, LOA, Lumper, PackingSlip, Photo, POD, PO, Quote, Reclassification, Scale, VendorDocs, WeightInsp, CSV, Excel, Word, Other

viewPermission values: 0 (Public), 1 (Staff), 2 (Manager); if nothing passed it will default to Staff

modifyPermission values: 1 (Staff), 2 (Manager); if nothing passed it will default to Staff

EndFragment

request.description:
This documentation provides an overview of the `CreateShipment` endpoint, which allows for the creation of a shipment based on provided details. This API is designed to be used with RESTful services, and this documentation is tailored for testing and integration using Postman.

#### Endpoint Information

- **URL**: `/CreateShipment/{customerId}`
    
- **Method**: `POST`
    
- **Authentication**: Required (Bearer Token)
    

#### Path Parameters

- **customerId** (`int`): The unique identifier of the customer for whom the shipment is being created.
    

#### Request Body

The request body must be a JSON object that includes shipment details. Key fields within this JSON object may include:

- `EquipmentType` (`string`): The type of equipment used for the shipment.
    
- `ShipmentMode` (`string`): The mode of the shipment.
    
- `CustomFields` (```List): A list of custom fields related to the shipment.- `BillToCode` (`int`, optional): The billing code for the shipment.      - `ShipmentStatus` (`string`, optional): The status of the shipment.      - `Accessorials` (`List`, optional): A list of accessorials associated with the shipment.      - `PickupDate` (`DateTime`): The scheduled pickup date for the shipment.      - `PickupOpenTime` (`DateTime`): The opening time for pickup.      - `PickupCloseTime` (`DateTime`): The closing time for pickup.      - `EstimatedDelivery` (`DateTime`, optional): The estimated delivery date.      - `EstimatedDeliveryOpenTime` (`DateTime`, optional): The opening time for the estimated delivery.      - `EstimatedDeliveryCloseTime` (`DateTime`, optional): The closing time for the estimated delivery.      - `PickupNumber` (`string`, optional): The pickup number associated with the shipment.      - `ShipperNumber` (`string`, optional): The shipper's number.      - `Items` (``List): A list of items being shipped.- Additional fields may include contact information, addresses, and specific shipment requirements or identifiers.       #### Successful Response  - **Status Code**: `200 OK`      - **Content-Type**: `application/json`      - **Body**: An object containing the details of the created shipment, including identifiers and status information.       #### Error Responses  - **Status Code**: `400 Bad Request`          - The request was invalid. Details about the invalid fields or parameters will be included in the response body.          - **Status Code**: `401 Unauthorized`          - Authentication credentials are missing or invalid.           Shipment Status Types: Quoted, Booked, Dispatched, Loading, InTransit, OutForDelivery, Refused, MissedDelivery, LoadingUnloading, Unloading, Delivered, OSD, CanceledWithCharges, Canceled  Mode Types: Intermodal, LTL, Truckload, Air, Drayage, HotShot, LclOcean, VolumePartial, Ocean, InternationalAir, Parcel , Auto , Bulk , RFLtl , Services , Rail , LiquidBulk  ### Create Shipment Api Model  - **PickupDate** (DateTime) - **PickupOpenTime** (DateTime) - **PickupCloseTime** (DateTime) - **EstimatedDelivery** (DateTime) - **EstimatedDeliveryOpenTime** (DateTime) - **EstimatedDeliveryCloseTime** (DateTimel) - **DeliveryDate** (DateTime) - **ShipperPickupArrival** (DateTime) - **ShipperPickupDeparture** (DateTime) - **ConsigneeDeliverArrival** (DateTime) - **ConsigneeDeliverDeparture** (DateTime) - **Source** (String; Max: 100 characters) - **PickupNumber** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **PoReference** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperNumber** (String; Max: 100 characters) - **ShipperAddress** (String) - **ShipperAddress2** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperCity** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperName** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperContact** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperEmail** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperPhone** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperFax** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ShipperLocationCode** (String) - **ConsigneeAddress** (String) - **ConsigneeAddress2** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeState** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeCity** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeName** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeContact** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeEmail** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneePhone** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeFax** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **ConsigneeLocationCode** (String) - **IsConsigneeCitySpecified** (Boolean) - **IsShipperCitySpecified** (Boolean) - **ReferenceNumber** (String; Max: 50 characters) - **BillOfLandingNote** (String; Max: 2000 characters) - **PalletCount** (Int32) - **ShipmentValue** (Decimal) - **Carrier** (CreateShipmnetCarrier; Custom class) - **ShipmentStatus** (String) - **CustomFields** (List; Custom class list) - **BillToCode** (Int32?; Optional) - **BuyerClientLoadId** (Int32?; Optional) - **AssignTo** (String) - **Test** (Boolean) - **IsUpdateIfDuplicatedReferenceNumber** (Boolean) - **IsPalletized** (Boolean) - **NumberOfPallets** (Int32)  ### CustomField  - **FieldName** (String) - **FieldValue** (String)  ### CreateShipmnetCarrier  - **CarrierScac** (String;   "shipperZip": "90755", // 6 Characters Max (CAN/US/MX) - REQUIRED
    "shipperCountry": "US", // USA, US, MX, CAN, CA; if USA or US is chosen, the same must be used on the consigneeCountry - REQUIRED
    "consigneeZip": "90802", // 6 Characters Max (CAN/US/MX) - REQUIRED
    "consigneeCountry": "US", // USA, US, MX, CAN, CA - REQUIRED
    "shipmentMode": "LTL", //REQUIRED
    "equipmentType": "Van", //REQUIRED
    "items": [ // 1 ITEM IS REQUIRED TO BE PASSED IN THE ARRAY
        {
            "productDescription": "Test Product!!!!", // 150 Characters Max; no tabs or character \ allowed - REQUIRED
            "class": "50", // 3 Characters Max; cannot be 'N/A','0', or null - REQUIRED
            "pieces": 1, // REQUIRED
            "weight": 50, // No decimals allowed - REQUIRED
            "isHazardous": false, // REQUIRED
            "packaging": "pallets", // REQUIRED
            "height": 40,// Cannot be less than or equal to '0'; decimals accepted to two places (ex. 48.75) - REQUIRED
            "length": 35, // Cannot be less than or equal to '0'; decimals accepted to two places (ex. 48.75) - REQUIRED
            "width": 45, // Cannot be less than or equal to '0'; decimals accepted to two places (ex. 48.75) - REQUIRED
            "sealNumber": "" // 100 Characters Max; leave as null unless known - OPTIONAL
        }
    ],
    "shipperAddress": "2699 E 28th St #406", // 150 Characters Max - REQUIRED
    "shipperAddress2": "", // 150 Characters Max - OPTIONAL
    "shipperName": "Test Name", // 50 Characters Max - REQUIRED
    "shipperContact": "Test Contact", // 50 Characters Max - REQUIRED
    "shipperEmail": "test@none.com", // 50 Characters Max - REQUIRED
    "shipperPhone": "(555) 555-5555", // 50 Characters Max - REQUIRED
    "consigneeAddress": "225 W. 3rd St.", // 150 Characters Max - REQUIRED
    "consigneeAddress2": "", // 150 Characters Max - OPTIONAL
    "consigneeName": "Test Name", // 50 Characters Max - REQUIRED
    "consigneeContact": "Test Contact", // 50 Characters Max - REQUIRED
    "consigneeEmail": "test@none.com", // 50 Characters Max - REQUIRED
    "consigneePhone": "(555) 555-5555", // 50 Characters Max - REQUIRED
    "poReference": "Test Po", // 100 Characters Max (Home Depot's PO Reference #) - REQUIRED
    "billOfLandingNote": "Test BOL", //  2000 Characters Max; any additional information that needs to be included on the BOL / Dispatch) - REQUIRED
    "pickupDate": "2018-08-18T20:12:53.284Z", // REQUIRED
    "pickupOpenTime": "2018-08-18T08:00:00.284Z", // REQUIRED
    "pickupCloseTime": "2018-08-18T18:00:00.284Z", // REQUIRED
    "estimatedDelivery": "2018-08-18T20:12:53.284Z", // REQUIRED
    "estimatedDeliveryOpenTime": "2018-08-18T13:00:00.284Z", //REQUIRED
    "estimatedDeliveryCloseTime": "2018-08-18T16:16:00.284Z", //REQUIRED
    "shipmentStatus": "Booked", // Hard Code - REQUIRED
    "shipperNumber": "123456789", // 100 Characters Max - REQUIRED

request.description:
This endpoint will allow you to cancel an active shipment associated with your account by simply passing the LoadId into the request.

**LoadId**: int

This documentation provides an overview of the `GetLoads` endpoint, which is used to retrieve load information within a specified date range and based on various criteria such as status and load ID. This API is designed to be used with RESTful services, and this documentation is tailored for testing and integration using Postman.

#### Endpoint Information

- **URL**: `/GetLoads`
    
- **Method**: `GET`
    
- **Authentication**: Required (Bearer Token)
    

#### Query Parameters

- **StartDate** (`DateTime`): The start date of the date range for which to retrieve loads.
    
- **EndDate** (`DateTime`): The end date of the date range for which to retrieve loads.
    
- **Status** (`string`): The status filter for the loads. It can have specific values that alter the query behavior, such as "dispatchnotcovered", "dispatch", "pending", "intransit", or "delivered". Other specific status values are also supported as defined in the `ShipmentStatuses` enumeration.
    
- **loadid** (`int`, optional): An optional load ID to retrieve a specific load. If provided, the service will filter the results to include only the specified load.
    

#### Successful Response

- **Status Code**: `200 OK`
    
- **Content-Type**: `application/json`
    
- **Body**: A list of load information objects, each containing details about the loads that match the query parameters.
    

#### Response Body Structure

The JSON response contains an array of objects with load details. Key fields in each object may include:

- LoadId
    
- CustomerName
    
- CustomerId
    
- Createdate
    
- PickupDate
    
- PickupOpenTime
    
- PickupCloseTime
    
- EstimatedDelivery
    
- EstimatedDeliveryOpenTime
    
- EstimatedDeliveryCloseTime
    
- DeliveryDate
    
- PickNum
    
- BOLNum
    
- ShipperNum
    
- Priority
    
- DriverType
    
- ReferenceNo
    
- Dockdate
    
- TargetRate
    
- Value
    
- PerPund
    
- Miles
    
- EquipmentType
    
- ShipmentMode
    
- CODAmount
    
- Assignedto
    
- Dispatcher
    
- PoReference
    
- BillOfLandingNote
    
- ShipmentStatus
    
- Carriers (array of carrier information)
    
- Accessorials (array of accessorial information)
    
- Items (array of shipment item information)
    
- Stops (array of stop address information)
    

Note: The actual structure and fields may vary based on your specific implementation and data model.

#### Error Responses

- **Status Code**: `400 Bad Request`
    
    - The request was invalid. Details about the invalid fields or parameters will be included in the response body.
        
- **Status Code**: `401 Unauthorized`
    
    - Authentication credentials are missing or invalid.

request.description:
Parameters:
- LoadID: Pass the load ID that you wish to send documents from within the system.
- Emails: Pass a list of emails separated by commas that you wish to send within the request.
- documentNames: Pass the list of documents you wish to have sent.

NOTES:
In order to get the current list of available documents to send, you need to pull them from the 'Get Docs by Load' endpoint.

The 'GetDocs' endpoint will provide you a list of all available documents currently ready to be sent via the 'Send Docs by Load' endpoint.

Parameters:
- LoadID: This is the system load ID.

This endpoint will return all documents by load id via a URL.

Available Document Types:

BOL
Invoice
Labels

Params:

LoadID

item.name: Get Open Invoices by Customer (Customer Specific)

request.description:
The invoices by customer endpoint is client specific. This endpoint will allow you to pull all open invoices for a specific customer within Brokerware, not all customers within Brokerware.

Params: None.

item.name: Get Open Invoices by Customer W/ Custom Fields

request.description:
Pulls an array of unpaid or partially paid invoices.
Parameters: startDate and endDate will filter on the Invoice Date
If parameters are not passed it will pull invoices for the last 30 days.

item.description:
Client Specific APIs are directly associated with your customer profiles. These APIs are a one to one relationship.

You can retrieve these API credentials by visiting your customers profile and clicking on 'API Keys' under the 'Customer Tools' portion of the profile.

request.description:
The 'Customer' endpoint will pull back a list of all customers within the application based on the modifiedDate (createdDate).

Params:  
startDate: Start Modified Date  
endDate: End Modified Date

NOTE: In order to pull all customers from the application, utilize min and max on the date range.

response.name: Get Customer List (Global)
response.body:

request.description:
The 'Carrier' endpoint will pull back a list of all carriers within the application based on the modifiedDate (createdDate). 

Params:
startDate: Start Modified Date
endDate: End Modified Date

NOTE: In order to pull all carriers from the application, utilize min and max on the date range.

request.description:
Get loads based on shipment status and when the shipment was last modified. Parameters:

• Status: Pass the status of the shipments you wish to receive data on. o Values: Quoted, Booked, Dispatched, Loading, InTransit, OutForDelivery, Refused, MissedDelivery, LoadingUnloading, Unloading, Delivered, OSD, CanceledWithCharges, Canceled

• StartDate: Pass the earliest date the shipment was last modified o Ex. 2021-09-01

• EndDate: Pass the latest date the shipment was last modified o Ex. 2021-10-05

request.description:
Upload a document to a specific LoadId.

Required: FileName, Extension, DocumentBase64, LoadId, Type  
Extensions: .tiff, .tif, .png, .doc, .xls, .pdf, .txt, .xlsx, .csv, .docx, .jpeg, .jpg, .gif, .pst, .ost, .jfif

Types: BOL, CarrierBill, CarrierPacket, Claim, CreditApp, DeliveryOrder, Detention, Dispatch, DocumentPacket, FactoringDocs, InsuranceDoc, Invoice, LOA, Lumper, PackingSlip, Photo, POD, PO, Quote, Reclassification, Scale, VendorDocs, WeightInsp, CSV, Excel, Word, Other

viewPermission values: 0 (Public), 1 (Staff), 2 (Manager); if nothing passed it will default to Staff

modifyPermission values: 1 (Staff), 2 (Manager); if nothing passed it will default to Staff

EndFragment

The Global Tracking endpoint allows you to track any shipment within Brokerware without requiring you to pull the client credentials for each individual client.

This endpoint allows you to track by four different shipment values that can be passed with 'type.'

0=Load  
1=Shipper Number  
2=PO Reference  
3=Pro Number

request.description:
The global ‘CreateShipmentAPI’ allows you to create a shipment for each customer within the Brokerware environment without having to retrieve  
a ClientID and ClientSecret for each. Instead, it utilizes the global ClientID, ClientSecret, and CustomerId in order to identify which customer it needs to  
create the load on.

In order to retrieve the CustomerId to pass within the API, you will need to utilize the GetCustomerList endpoint. Within this endpoint, you  
will receive a CustomerId within the payload.

The example provides the format as well as sample data that should be passed within the API.

EndFragment

Send tracking mileston updates to Brokerware

- This requires registration with 3PL Systems in order to use

    - LoadNumber
    - Source (Tracking Source Type - ID given to you after registration)
    - Event \[X3, AF, X1, D1\]
    - EventTimeStampUtc
    - Latitude
    - Longitude
    - StopName (Company/Location Name)
    - City, State, Zip, Country

    - LoadNumber
    - Source (Tracking Source Type - ID given to you after registration)
    - GeoLocationTimestampUtc
    - Latitude
    - Longitude
    - City, State, Zip, Country

 **WeightType** to Pass in API  
     lbs     kg

item.description:
Global APIs allow you to perform actions to any customer, carrier, or shipment without having to retrieve customer specific API credentials. This should not be shared with your customers and should only be used for custom integrations with your WMS, ERP, Accounting Systems, or an internal based platform that runs side-by-side with your TMS.

You can find the 'Global API Keys' under 'General Information' found in the upper right hand corner of the system.

item.name: Global Accounting Endpoints (Broker Only)

request.description:
This endpoint will allow you to pull all applied vendor payments out of Brokerware.

Params:

StartDate: 2021-05-05

EndDate: 2021-05-05

This API, `GetCompletedVendorPaymentByCreatedDate`, retrieves a filtered list of completed vendor payments within a specified date range, meeting certain criteria. The method returns an `IActionResult`, which can vary depending on the outcome (e.g., a list of vendor payments or a bad request error if the data set is too large). Below are the fields and data types involved in the request and response of this API:

### Request Parameters:

- **startDate** (`DateTime`): The start date of the range to filter the completed vendor payments.
- **endDate** (`DateTime`): The end date of the range to filter the completed vendor payments.
    

### Filter Conditions:

Vendor payments are filtered based on the following criteria:

- Completion date is within the specified start and end dates.
- Status is active.
- Excludes payments marked as QuickPay unless they are also marked as TriumphPay.
- Balance is greater than 0.
- Payment method is not "Credit".
- Includes payments marked as TriumphPay, or those without a TruckStopPayment, or those with a TruckStopPayment having a StatusId of 2 or 3.
    

### Projection:

The filtered records are projected into a new `VendorPayment` object with the following fields:

- **Guid** (`Guid`): Unique identifier, derived from `QBRef`.
- **CheckAmount** (`decimal`): The payment balance.
- **CheckDate** (`DateTime`): The payment date.
- **CheckNumber** (`string`): Reference number of the payment.
- **Type** (`string`): Description of the payment status.
- **VoidedDate** (`DateTime?`): The date the payment was voided, if applicable.
- **VendorId** (`int`): Identifier of the vendor.
- **CreatedDate** (`DateTime`): Date when the payment record was created.
- **ModifiedDate** (`DateTime`): Date when the payment record was last modified.
- **CompletedDate** (`DateTime`): Date when the payment was completed.
- **IsQuickPay** (`bool`): Indicates if the payment was a QuickPay.
- **Status** (`string`): Set to "Completed".
- **Detail** (`IEnumerable`): Collection of detailed payment records, each with its own set of fields (Guid, AmountPaid, Type, DocumentNumber).
    

### VendorPaymentDetail Projection:

Each `VendorPaymentDetail` contains:

- **Guid** (`Guid`): Unique identifier, potentially the `Guid` of `CarrierBill`.
- **AmountPaid** (`decimal`): Paid balance.
- **Type** (`string`): Description based on account type or payment type.
- **DocumentNumber** (`string`): Bill number if available.
    

### Response:

- **BadRequest** (`IActionResult`): Returned if the filtered data set exceeds 10,000 records.
- **Ok** (`IActionResult`): Returns the filtered and processed list of `VendorPayment` objects.
    

This method also includes logic to adjust `IsQuickPay` status and aggregate `Detail` entries for items marked as QuickPay, ensuring accurate representation of payment details.

request.description:
This endpoint will pull all open payables within Brokerware for all clients based on posted (created) date.

Credentials: Global Credentials

Params:

StartDate: 2020-07-06

EndDate: 2020-07-06

This API, `GetAccountPayableBypostedDate`, retrieves a list of account payable records filtered by their creation dates within a specified date range and subject to additional criteria. It is designed to return an `IActionResult`, which can vary between a successful data payload and a BadRequest error, depending on the size of the data retrieved. Here are the details of the fields and data types involved in both the request and the response of this API:

### Request Parameters:

- **startDate** (`DateTime`): The start date of the range for filtering the account payables.
- **endDate** (`DateTime`): The end date of the range for filtering the account payables.
    

### Included Entities:

- **CarrierBillApplyCredit**: Includes related credit applications to the bills.
- **PaidBillDetail**: Includes details of the bills that have been paid, nested within `CarrierBillApplyCredit`.
- **CarrierBill**: Includes carrier bill details, nested within `PaidBillDetail`.
    

### Filter Conditions:

Bills are filtered based on the following criteria:

- Creation date is within the specified start and end dates.
- The payer's invoice preference is either not set or does not have `DoNotSyncApiData` enabled.
- Bill has confirmed payable status.
- Sync status is not marked for removal or associated with removal errors.
    

### Projection:

The filtered records are projected into an anonymous object with the following fields:

- **Id** (`int`): The bill's identifier.
- **VendorId** (`int`): The carrier's unique identifier.
- **VendorMc** (`string`): The carrier's MC number.
- **VendorDot** (`string`): The carrier's DOT number.
- **LoadNumber** (`string`): Client's load identifier.
- **ProNumber** (`string`): Shipment carrier's PRO number.
- **BillNumber** (`string`): The bill number.
- **IsQuickPay** (`bool`): Indicates whether the bill was processed as QuickPay.
- **ClientName** (`string`): The name of the shipment's customer.
- **Terms** (`string`): Sale term associated with the bill.
- **InvoiceDate** (`DateTime`): The date the bill is payable.
- **CreatedDate** (`DateTime`): Date when the bill record was created.
- **ModifiedDate** (`DateTime`): Date when the bill record was last modified.
- **OfficeLocation** (`string`): Description of the office location based on shipment details.
- **GUID** (`Guid`): Unique identifier for the bill.
- **OriginalGuid** (`string`): Concatenated GUIDs of the original bills, if applicable.
- **OriginalBillNumber** (`string`): Concatenated bill numbers of the original bills, if applicable.
- **Type** (`string`): Indicates whether the bill was posted or modified.
- **Mode** (`string`): The mode of shipment.
- **Amount** (`decimal`): The balance payable on the bill.
    

### Response:

- **BadRequest** (`IActionResult`): Returned if the total number of filtered bills exceeds 10,000, indicating the data set is too large to process.
- **Ok** (`IActionResult`): Returns a list of the filtered and processed bill records as an anonymous object.
    

This API effectively filters and processes account payable records, incorporating complex logic to include necessary details for each record, such as handling original bills and determining whether a bill was posted or modified based on its creation and modification timestamps.

request.description:
This endpoint will pull all open payables, that have been modified, within Brokerware for all clients.

Credentials: Global Credentials

Params:

StartDate: 2020-07-06

EndDate: 2020-07-06

This API, `GetAccountPayableByModifiedDate`, is designed to fetch account payable records that have been modified within a specified date range, applying additional filtering criteria to refine the selection. It provides an `IActionResult` that can either be a collection of account payable records or a BadRequest error if the data set exceeds a certain threshold. Here's an in-depth look at the elements involved in this API's request and response:

### Request Parameters:

- **startDate** (`DateTime`): The starting date of the range to filter the modified account payables.
    
- **endDate** (`DateTime`): The ending date of the range to filter the modified account payables.
    

### Included Entities:

- **CarrierBillApplyCredit**: Related credit applications to the bills are included.
    
- **PaidBillDetail**: Details of the bills that have been paid, nested within `CarrierBillApplyCredit`.
    
- **CarrierBill**: Carrier bill details, nested within `PaidBillDetail`.
    

### Filter Conditions:

The selection of bills is narrowed down based on several conditions:

- Modification date falls within the specified start and end dates.
    
- Invoice preference is not set to prevent sync, or it's explicitly allowed.
    
- Bill must have confirmed payable status.
    
- Sync status is not marked for removal or related errors.
    
- Modification date is significantly after the creation date (more than 2 minutes later), ensuring only genuinely modified records are fetched.
    

### Projection:

Filtered records are transformed into an anonymous object structure with the following fields:

- **Id** (`int`): Identifier of the bill.
    
- **VendorId** (`int`): Carrier's unique ID.
    
- **VendorMc** (`string`): Carrier's MC number.
    
- **VendorDot** (`string`): Carrier's DOT number.
    
- **LoadNumber** (`string`): Client's load ID.
    
- **ProNumber** (`string`): Shipment carrier's PRO number.
    
- **BillNumber** (`string`): The bill number.
    
- **ClientName** (`string`): Company name of the shipment's customer.
    
- **Terms** (`string`): Sale term associated with the bill.
    
- **IsQuickPay** (`bool`): Indicates if the bill was processed as QuickPay.
    
- **InvoiceDate** (`DateTime`): Date the bill is payable.
    
- **CreatedDate** (`DateTime`): Creation date of the bill record.
    
- **ModifiedDate** (`DateTime`): Modification date of the bill record.
    
- **OfficeLocation** (`string`): Descriptive location of the office, based on the shipment details.
    
- **GUID** (`Guid`): Unique identifier for the bill.
    
- **OriginalGuid** and **OriginalBillNumber** (`string`): Concatenated GUIDs and bill numbers of original bills, if applicable, separated by commas.
    
- **Type** (`string`): Indicates whether the record was "Posted" or "Modified".
    
- **Mode** (`string`): Description of the shipment mode.
    
- **Amount** (`decimal`): Payable balance of the bill.
    

### Response:

- **BadRequest** (`IActionResult`): Returned if the number of filtered bills exceeds 10,000, indicating the dataset is too large for processing.
    
- **Ok** (`IActionResult`): Delivers the list of processed account payable records as an anonymous object.
    

This API effectively screens and organizes modified account payable records based on the specified criteria, presenting detailed insights into each selected bill, including adjustments and modifications made after the initial posting.

request.description:
The 'applyPayment' endpoint will allow you to apply carrier payments to the shipments within the application utilizing the GUIDS associated with each.

Params:  
CheckNumber: This field should be populated with the check number that was used to pay the carrier.

checkDate: Date you want to show the shipment was paid.

checkBalance: The amount of the check being applied to the payment to the carrier.

memo: Check memo

checkId: Unique check ID from your system.

billPaymentDetails: \[

guid: This is the invoice guid pulled from the 'AccountsPayable' endpoint.

paidAmount: The amount that is being paid to the line item.  
\]

NOTE: You cannot apply the same payment(checkID) twice. If you need to, you will need to VOID the original payment.

**Additional Details:

**The `ApplyBillPayment` API is designed to apply payments to bills based on a provided set of bill payment details through a `POST` request. This method processes an input model of type `BillPaymentApi`, verifies the integrity and applicability of the payment, and applies it accordingly. Here's a detailed breakdown of its operation, input model, validation checks, and possible responses:

### Input Model: `BillPaymentApi`

The `BillPaymentApi` model is expected to contain details about the payment to be applied, including information about the bills to which the payment should be applied and the payment's attributes like check number, date, and balance. Key fields within this model include:

- **CheckId**: Identifier for the check used for payment.
- **CheckNumber**: Number of the check.
- **CheckDate**: Date on which the check was issued.
- **CheckBalance**: Total amount available in the check.
- **BillPaymentDetails**: A collection detailing the bills to be paid, each entry containing the bill's GUID and the amount paid towards it.
- **Memo**: Additional information or notes about the payment.
    

### Operation Steps and Validation Checks:

1. **Client ID Extraction**: Extracts the client's ID from the user's HttpContext, ensuring operations are scoped to the right client.
2. **Model State Validation**: Checks if the input model is valid. If not, it returns a BadRequest response with the model state errors.
3. **Payment Detail Validation**: Verifies that the sum of the applied amounts matches the check balance. If there's a discrepancy, it returns a BadRequest response indicating the check balance mismatch.
4. **Check Existence Validation**: Confirms the check has not been previously used. If the check is found to be used, it returns a BadRequest response.
5. **Bill Existence and Consistency Check**: Ensures that the bills referenced exist and belong to a single carrier. It returns a BadRequest response if no applicable bills are found or if the bills span multiple carriers.
6. **Payment Application**: If all validations pass, it proceeds to apply the payment to the identified bills, linking each payment detail to its corresponding bill based on GUID.
    

### Helper Methods:

- **GetBillLoadId(List bills, Guid guid)**: Fetches the LoadId for a bill identified by its GUID.
- **GetBillId(List bills, Guid guid)**: Retrieves the ID for a bill based on its GUID.
    

### Responses:

- **Ok(true)**: Indicates successful application of the payment.
- **BadRequest("Error Message")**: Returns an error message indicating the reason for the failure, which could be due to an invalid model state, check balance mismatch, reused check, bills not found, or bills from different carriers.
    

### Summary

This API method is crucial for financial operations within a logistics or carrier management system, ensuring that payments are correctly applied to bills under stringent validation to maintain data integrity and operational consistency. It automates the verification of payment details against existing records, applying payments accurately and reporting any discrepancies through structured responses.

The 'Void AP Payment' endpoint allows you to void a customer payment on an invoice.

Params:

CheckID: The checkId is the unique ID that you original provided in the 'AR Payment' transaction.

VoidNote: This is the reason for the void payment.

The `VoidBillPayment` API is designed to void a bill payment based on a specific check, effectively marking the payment as cancelled or void. It processes a `POST` request containing a `VoidedBillApi` model as input, which includes the check identifier and an optional note explaining the reason for voiding the payment. Here's a detailed analysis of its operation, input model, validation process, and potential responses:

### Input Model: `VoidedBillApi`

The `VoidedBillApi` model includes essential information for identifying and processing the voiding of a bill payment:

- **CheckId** (`string`): The identifier of the check associated with the bill payment to be voided. It's critical for locating the payment record.
- **VoidedNote** (`string`, optional): A note or comment providing context or reasons for voiding the payment. This is useful for record-keeping and audits.
    

### Operation Steps and Validation Checks:

1. **Check ID Validation**: Verifies that the `CheckId` field in the input model is not null or empty. If it is, an error is added to the model state indicating that the Check Id is required.
2. **Model State Validation**: Checks if the model state is valid, which would be compromised if the Check Id were missing or any other validation issues were found. If the model state is invalid, it returns a BadRequest response containing the model state errors.
3. **Client ID Extraction**: Retrieves the client's ID from the user's HttpContext claims, ensuring the operation is performed within the correct client context.
4. **Check Existence Validation**: Determines whether the specified check exists within the client's records. If the check does not exist, it returns a BadRequest response indicating the issue.
5. **Void Operation**: If the check exists, it proceeds to void the bill payment associated with the specified Check Id, also recording the provided `VoidedNote` for auditing purposes.
    

### Responses:

- **Ok(true)**: Indicates that the bill payment has been successfully voided.
- **BadRequest("Error Message")**: Returns an error message if the check does not exist or if there are issues with the input model, such as a missing Check Id.
    

### Summary

This API method plays a crucial role in financial and payment management within systems that handle billings, such as logistics or accounting platforms. It allows for the controlled cancellation of payments, enhancing the system's ability to manage and rectify financial transactions. The validation steps ensure the integrity of the request, preventing unauthorized or incorrect voiding actions, and maintaining accurate financial records.

This endpoint will pull all open receivables within Brokerware for all clients.

Credentials: Global Credentials

Params:

StartDate: 2020-07-06

EndDate: 2020-07-06

The `GetAccountReceivableByCreateDate` API is structured to retrieve account receivable records based on their creation date within a specified date range. It is geared towards POST requests and utilizes nullable `DateTime` parameters to offer flexibility in query execution. This method filters invoices that meet certain criteria and converts them into account receivable records. Let's delve into the operation, input parameters, processing logic, and response mechanism of this API:

### Input Parameters:

- **startDate** (`DateTime?`): The start date of the range for filtering account receivable records by their creation date. It's nullable to accommodate queries without a specific start date.
    
- **endDate** (`DateTime?`): The end date of the range for filtering account receivable records by their creation date. Similar to `startDate`, it's nullable.
    

### Operation Steps and Validation Checks:

1. **Client ID Extraction**: Retrieves the client's ID from the `HttpContext.User` claims, ensuring that operations are scoped to the correct client.
    
2. **Invoices Querying and Filtering**: Fetches invoice records for the specified client ID from the `_invoiceService`, applying several filters:
    
    - The invoice's creation date falls within the provided date range (`startDate` to `endDate`).
        
    - The invoice's payer does not have an invoice preference set to prevent data sync.
        
    - The invoice's sync status does not indicate removal or associated errors.
        
3. **Conversion to Account Receivable**: Transforms the filtered invoice records into `AccountReceivable` objects through the `GetAccountReceivable` method, which is presumably a custom function for mapping or converting invoices based on specific logic.
    
4. **Data Volume Check**: Assesses if the resulting collection exceeds 10,000 records. If it does, a BadRequest response is returned to prevent overwhelming the system or client with too much data.
    
5. **Result Preparation and Sync Check**: If the data volume is manageable, the method proceeds to fetch the `AccountingSyncType` for the client and conditionally triggers a sync operation if the sync type is not QuickBooks Desktop or QuickBooks Online, indicating an integration with an API-based accounting system might be in place.
    

### Responses:

- **Ok(result)**: Returns the filtered and converted account receivable records as a successful response.
    
- **BadRequest("Data is too large")**: Indicates that the query resulted in an excessively large data set, which could compromise performance or exceed response size limits.
    

### Summary

This API method is crucial for systems needing to extract and process account receivable information based on invoice creation dates, especially within financial, accounting, or ERP systems. It showcases a sophisticated filtering mechanism that accounts for user preferences and system sync statuses, ensuring that the data retrieved is relevant and actionable. Moreover, the conditional sync operation underscores the method's role in maintaining up-to-date financial records across integrated accounting platforms.

request.description:
The 'applyPayment' endpoint will allow you to apply customer payments to the shipments within the application utilizing the GUIDS associated with each.

Params:  
CheckNumber: This field should be populated with the check number that was used to pay the shipment.

checkDate: Date you want to show the shipment was paid.

checkBalance: The amount of the check being applied to the shipment.

memo: Check memo

checkId: Unique check ID from your system.

invoicePaymentDetails: \[

guid: This is the invoice guid pulled from the 'AccountsReceivable' endpoint.

paidAmount: The amount that is being paid to the line item.  
\]

NOTE: You cannot apply the same payment(checkID) twice. If you need to, you will need to VOID the original payment.

The `ApplyInvoicePayment` API is designed to apply payments to invoices based on a set of provided details within a `POST` request. This method processes the input contained in the `InvoicePaymentApi` model, verifies the validity of the payment information, and applies it to the specified invoices. Let's explore the structure of this API, including its input model, validation processes, and expected responses:

### Input Model: `InvoicePaymentApi`

The `InvoicePaymentApi` model contains the necessary information for applying a payment to one or more invoices:

- **CheckId** (`string`): The identifier for the check used for payment.
    
- **CheckNumber** (`string`): The check number.
    
- **CheckDate** (`DateTime`): The date the check was issued.
    
- **CheckBalance** (`decimal`): The total amount available in the check for payment.
    
- **InvoicePaymentDetails** (`List`): A collection of details specifying the invoices to be paid, each including the invoice's GUID and the paid amount.
    
- **Memo** (`string`): An optional field for including additional information or notes about the payment.
    

### Operation Steps and Validation Checks:

1. **Client ID Extraction**: Retrieves the client's ID from `HttpContext.User` claims to ensure the operation is scoped correctly.
    
2. **Model State Validation**: Checks if the input model is valid. If not, returns a BadRequest response with model state errors.
    
3. **Payment Detail Validation**: Ensures that the sum of the paid amounts matches the check balance. If there's a discrepancy, returns a BadRequest response indicating the issue.
    
4. **Check Existence Validation**: Determines if the check has already been used. If so, returns a BadRequest response to prevent duplicate payments.
    
5. **Invoice Retrieval and Validation**: Fetches invoices based on the client ID and the GUIDs provided in the `InvoicePaymentDetails`. Validates that invoices exist and are payable to a single payer to ensure payment consistency.
    
6. **Payment Application**: If all validations pass, applies the payment to the specified invoices, using details from `InvoicePaymentDetails` to create `PaymentItemModel` instances for each invoice.
    

### Helper Methods:

- **GetInvoiceLoadId(List invoices, Guid guid)**: Retrieves the LoadId associated with a specified invoice, identified by GUID.
    
- **GetInvoiceId(List invoices, Guid guid)**: Fetches the ID for an invoice based on its GUID.
    

### Responses:

- **Ok(true)**: Indicates successful application of the payment to the specified invoices.
    
- **BadRequest("Error Message")**: Returns an error message for various validation failures, such as mismatched check balance, reused check, no invoices found for payment, or invoices from different payers.
    

### Summary

This API method is crucial for financial operations within systems that manage invoices and payments, such as ERP, accounting, or logistics platforms. It automates the application of payments to invoices under strict validation rules, ensuring that payments are correctly allocated and recorded. This process includes checks for the validity of the payment details, the existence and consistency of the invoices to be paid, and the uniqueness of the check to avoid double payments.

The 'Void AR Payment' endpoint allows you to void a customer payment on an invoice.

Params:

CheckID: The checkId is the unique ID that you original provided in the 'AR Payment' transaction.

VoidNote: This is the reason for the void payment.

The `VoidInvoicePayment` API is crafted to void or cancel an invoice payment, marked by a specific check ID. It handles a `POST` request that includes a `VoidedInvoiceApi` model, performing validations to ensure the input is correct and that the specified payment can be voided. Below is a detailed breakdown of its components, operational logic, and responses:

### Endpoint:

- `[Route("invoice/voidpayment")]`
    
- `[HttpPost]`
    

### Purpose:

To cancel or void a payment made towards an invoice, typically identified by the check ID used for the payment. This functionality is crucial for correcting errors in payment application, handling returned checks, or adjusting invoice records for various reasons.

### Input Model: `VoidedInvoiceApi`

The input model contains essential information required to identify and process the voiding of an invoice payment:

- **CheckId** (`string`): The identifier of the check associated with the payment to be voided. It's essential for locating the specific payment record.
    
- **VoidedNote** (`string`, optional): A note providing context or the reason for voiding the payment, which can be useful for auditing and record-keeping purposes.
    

### Operation Steps and Validation Checks:

1. **Check ID Validation**: Verifies that the `CheckId` is provided; if not, it adds an error to the model state indicating that the Check Id cannot be null or empty.
    
2. **Model State Validation**: If the model state is invalid (due to missing `CheckId` or other issues), it returns a `BadRequest` response with the model state errors.
    
3. **Client ID Extraction**: Retrieves the client's ID from `HttpContext.User` claims to scope the operation appropriately.
    
4. **Check Existence Validation**: Checks if the specified check exists for the given client ID. If the check does not exist, it returns a `BadRequest` response with a message indicating that the check does not exist.
    
5. **Void Operation**: If the check exists, it proceeds to void the invoice payment associated with the specified Check Id and records the provided `VoidedNote` for auditing purposes.
    

### Responses:

- **Ok(true)**: Indicates the payment has been successfully voided, reflecting the successful cancellation of the payment within the system.
    
- **BadRequest("Error Message")**: Returns an error message detailing the reason for the failure, such as an invalid model state (missing Check Id) or the non-existence of the specified check.
    

### Summary:

This API method facilitates the voiding of invoice payments, a critical capability within financial, accounting, or ERP systems that manage invoice processing and payments. It enforces checks to ensure the integrity and correctness of the voiding process, including verifying the existence of the payment to be voided and ensuring required information is provided. This process helps maintain accurate financial records and allows for the rectification of payment applications as necessary.

The `GetCommission` API is designed to fetch commission-related information for a given date range, filtering based on various criteria and enriching the data with related entities to construct a comprehensive view of commissions. This endpoint plays a crucial role in financial and sales analysis, providing insights into commissions earned on shipments within a specified timeframe. Here's a detailed exploration of its structure, operational logic, and the kind of response it generates:

### Endpoint:

- `[Route("Commission")]`
    

### Purpose:

To retrieve detailed commission information related to shipments for a specified client within a given date range, including sales representative details, shipment costs, billing information, and invoice details.

### Operation Logic:

1. **Client ID Extraction**: Determines the client's ID from `HttpContext.User` claims to ensure that the retrieved data is scoped to the appropriate client.
    
2. **Data Retrieval and Filtering**: Fetches commission data from the `_commissionService`, applying includes for related entities like `ShipmentCommission`, `Shipment`, `Payer`, and `Customer` to gather necessary details. The data is filtered based on the creation date of the commission records, whether the sales user is marked as the primary commission recipient, if the commission has been released, and if the commission type matches `AccountType.Bill`.
    
3. **Data Projection**: Projects the filtered commission data into instances of `CommisionApi`, structuring the response to include a wealth of details such as load ID, sales representative name and ID, email, cost and bill amounts, billing company information, customer information, commission balance and ID, bill number with revision, and detailed invoice data including invoice payments.
    
4. **Response Construction**: Converts the projected `CommisionApi` instances into `CommissionApiResponse`, tailoring the response to include critical information such as bill amount, billing company, customer name and ID, commission balance, cost, created and modified dates, invoice details (date, paid amount, payment date), load ID, margin, release date, sales representative details, shipment mode, and the type of commission.
    

### Response:

- **Ok(CommissionApiResponse\[\])**: Delivers a collection of `CommissionApiResponse` objects, each encapsulating detailed commission information for the client within the specified date range. This response provides a holistic view of commissions, enabling analysis of sales performance, shipment profitability, and customer billing.
    

### Summary:

This API endpoint is a vital tool for financial analysis, sales tracking, and accounting purposes within a business that relies on commissions as a part of its revenue structure. It leverages extensive data relations to provide a detailed breakdown of commissions, supporting transparency and enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions based on comprehensive financial data.

item.description: 3PL Systems, Inc. is proud to have a robust API engine that allows you to integrate with any third party accounting system. Our clients have integrated into SAP, Microsoft GP, Netsuite, and other ERP based accounting systems. This will allow you to move away from QuickBooks Desktop, QuickBooks Online, or a Flat File integration which are all native to Brokerware.
